comment: He comes off stoic and quiet, but if you attend his office hours and talk to him face-to-face he's a sweet, caring person and you will understand why he's such a tough grader. As long as you keep in contact with him and be upfront, he's understanding.

While attendance was not mandatory, he frequently gave out in-class assignments and presentations that could only be completed in person. This seemed to contradict his initial stance on attendance. Additionally, Professor Mabry was not very approachable and often came across as mean. He was very strict with grading for a beginner course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He grades pretty hard. if you attend class and do the assignments, you will do just fine in his classes. He is willing to work with you on make-up if you get a bad grade, but you must get him early.

He's a good guy for sure. He's a tough grader. He is likable and is not your typical professor. He is funny, and very straightforward and he wants it his way. Overall he is good, just make sure to go to class because it helps a lot and he takes some attendance through group work

Mabry was a decent professor. He is very chill and gives lots of extra credit. Class is built around one big research project. As long as you show up, do your work, and ask for help if you need it you will get an easy A.

He is a tough grader when it came down to the  essays, but provided good feedback on what you need to improve on. Showing up to class is important because he does mini lessons on how to effectively write your essays, which helped me. Other than that a very funny professor and there was not a lot of homework to worry about.

Professor Mabry is a good teacher but he can be a hard one. He will not accept late work or half done assignments. I took both his English 1101 and 1102. His class is usually a bunch of assignments that lead up to a big essay in the end. Being in class is heavily recommended, he will put grades in you can't make up for not being there.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I took him last semester for English 1101. He is a great teacher and provides you with adequate material to help you write your final essay, but he is a very tough grader and sometimes is very hard to reach via email, so it is best to ask him questions in class. Online content isn't too tough, just do the work. Just fix these issues, and he is fine

If youre not even the slightest good at writing, I wouldnt recommend his class. He is a cool teacher and funny. There are few writings the semester with little work in between but he is a TOUGH grader. Ultimately thats really why I didnt like his class. In my opinion There are far more understanding teachers who will work with you instead of him

He's ok, gives good feedback, but it hard to reach and offers poor communication to his class. He seems to know that, too. He cusses a lot which is fine if he were a student but it comes off unprofessional which I don't really look up to. A lot of unnecessary assignments. I would've tried to find someone else if I knew what I was getting into.

Professor Mabry is a great guy. I took him for English 1101 last semester and he quickly became one of my favorite professors. He is a bit of a tough grader, but is one of the funniest people I met and tries to make the class entertaining. I highly recommend him!

Mabry is a professor that I will never get. You do the work, come to class, and clearly care about the class, but you will still not end up with an A. He grades papers so specifically, and will give you a low grade even though you did the work correctly. Avoid professor Mabry!! I warned you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Mabry is a great professor! He gives good exercises for your writing assignments, which there are only 3 papers due the whole semester with very small assignments in between. While attendance isnt mandatory, going to class and participating will help get a clearer understanding of the topic. He connects well with the class. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Hes a great professor! I definitely recommend taking him! Clear grading, good feedback, relatable. Just come to class and do your work and you will be good !
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback
Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
